name: Sky Line T-Shirt
description:
Unisex T-shirt

Super Limited FIRST Run. one of only six printed.

100% Polyester with PURE-tech™ permanent moisture wicking technology, allowing the fabric to breath, remain odour and stainless throughout its lifespan.

Although Polyester is commonly misconceived as being bad for the environment it is actually much easier to care for post-production, and how you care for your clothes accounts for up to 80% of its carbon footprint. You can wash this garment at 30ºc, line dry, it doesn't crease and it's super soft (even softer then organic cotton.) As it's produced in really small runs there is no wasted stock and you get to own something truly unique.

Made in Colombia - Colombia has been recognised as one of the top ten countries on Yale University's Environmental Performance Index. The manufacturing facility used to produce these t-shirts benefits by having access to hydro- and geo-thermal electricity sources. Over 65% of their manufacturing facility's power has been generated via hydro-electric from 2003.

Printed in Ohio - This garment has been printed using a method called 'sublimation printing'; a dry process that uses heat to transfer a design from paper onto a synthetic fabric. As no water is used the prints are dry and ready to handle as soon as they exit the printer so there is no need to rinse screens or fabrics as there is with traditional screen printing and dying methods which in turn significantly reduces their environmental impact. Additionally, a tree is planted with every order placed at the printers too, just another little thing we do to help offset our carbon footprint.

White patches - you will notice under the arms and around some side seams there will be some small gaps in the print; this is a side affect of the printing process, and something that simply adds character. These marks make the garment entirely unique.
